titleInfo.title: Mississippi River hydrographic survey below Old River, 1937.

mods.abstract: Hydrographic survey of Mississippi River between West Baton Rouge Parish and East Baton Rouge Parish. Shows names of some property owners, particularly in West Baton Rouge Parish. Relief shown by bathymetric soundings and isolines. Sheet 72 of set. Much of map, including half of title block, faded, with lettering illegible. Inset map shows overview of entire project, subdivided into sections; i.e., Sheets 68-78. Scale 1:10,000. '‘NOTE: Contours in areas without elevations taken from Caving Bank Survey Jan. 1934, Low Water Survey of 1929-30, and levels used for Quadrangle Mapping…’
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Access to unprocessed collections requires the permission of the curator, subject to Special Collections’ Policy on Access to Unprocessed Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/about/unprocessed.html)
mods.note: William Waller Survey Collection, Mss. 3592, 3910, 4326, Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Collections, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
